# Small Community Water System Funding Options (2026)

## Definition of "Small"

- Population ≤ 10,000, OR
- ≤ 3,300 service connections

## Small Community Drinking Water (SCDW) Program

### Eligibility
- Small community water systems
- Disadvantaged Communities (DAC): MHI < 80% statewide -- check with [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/)
- Severely Disadvantaged Communities (SDAC): MHI < 60% statewide

### Eligible Applicants
- Nonprofit organizations
- Public agencies
- Tribal governments
- For-profit water utilities
- Nonprofit mutual water companies

### Financial Terms
- **Interest rate:** 0% (zero percent)
- **Repayment:** Up to 40 years
- **Principal forgiveness:** Available for DAC/SDAC

### Eligible Projects
- Treatment systems
- Distribution systems
- Interconnections
- Consolidations
- Pipeline extensions
- Water sources
- Meters

Program details available at [CA Grants Portal - SCDW](https://www.grants.ca.gov/grants/small-community-drinking-water-scdw-funding-program/).

## Technical Assistance Funding

### Services Covered (Free)
- Project coordination and development
- Engineering and environmental analysis
- Legal assistance
- Leak detection and water audits
- Compliance audits
- Financial analysis
- TMF assessments
- Board/operator training

See [Technical Assistance Funding](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/tech_asst_funding.html) for details.

### Priority for TA
1. Systems out of compliance
2. Insufficient water delivery
3. Drought/contamination-impacted communities
4. Consolidation projects
5. Systems < 200 connections
6. Small requests enabling funding applications

### How to Request TA
- Contact State Water Board
- Describe need and situation
- High demand - not all requests accommodated

## SAFER Program for Small Systems

### Emergency/Urgent Support
- Interim water supplies through the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/)
- Emergency repairs
- Hauled water

### Operations & Maintenance
- Direct O&M funding program
- Help with day-to-day costs
- For struggling small systems

### Professional Administrators
- Funding for system management
- When internal capacity lacking

## Consolidation Incentives

### Benefits of Consolidation
- Access to larger system resources
- Improved compliance capacity
- Economies of scale
- Potentially lower rates long-term

### Funding Support
- SAFER prioritizes consolidation
- Technical assistance available
- Construction funding for connections

## How to Get Started

### Step 1: Assess Your Situation
- System size and type
- Compliance status
- DAC/SDAC determination via [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/)
- Immediate needs

### Step 2: Contact State Water Board
- Financial Assistance: (916) 341-5700
- Technical Assistance Program
- SAFER Program

### Step 3: Explore Options
- Discuss all available programs at [Sustainable Water Solutions](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/sustainable_water_solutions/)
- Get guidance on best fit
- Consider consolidation if appropriate

## Take Action

1. **Check program eligibility** -- Visit the [CA Grants Portal - SCDW](https://www.grants.ca.gov/grants/small-community-drinking-water-scdw-funding-program/) for application requirements and current funding availability.
2. **Request free technical assistance** -- Apply for free TA through the [Technical Assistance Funding](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/water_issues/programs/grants_loans/tech_asst_funding.html) program for engineering, legal, and compliance help.
3. **Explore SAFER options** -- Visit the [SAFER Program](https://www.waterboards.ca.gov/safer/) page for emergency support, O&M funding, and consolidation assistance for small systems.
4. **Determine DAC status** -- Use the [DAC Mapping Tool](https://gis.water.ca.gov/app/dacs/) to check if your community qualifies for 0% interest loans and principal forgiveness.
5. **Contact Financial Assistance** -- Call (916) 341-5700 to discuss your system's needs, available funding programs, and next steps for application.
